title: Marlins' first exhibition at new stadium sold out
subtitle: Marlins' first exhibition at new stadium sold out
body: MIAMI -- The Marlins' first sellout at their new stadium is in the books, but seats still remain for their second exhibition in Miami. The Marlins on Monday announced that no tickets remain for their March 6 exhibition against the University of Miami. As part of a series of soft opening games at the club's new home, only 10,000 tickets were sold for the 7:10 p.m. ET contest against the Hurricanes. The team has 15,000 tickets up for sale for its March 7 meeting with Florida International University. The exhibitions are the Marlins' first at their new retractable-roof home, which holds 37,000.  Spring Training gets under way on Feb. 22, the first day Miami's pitchers and catchers conduct workouts at Roger Dean Stadium in Jupiter, Fla. Full-squad practices begin on Feb. 26.  The Marlins' Grapefruit League opener is set for March 5 against the Cardinals. Miami and St. Louis share the Roger Dean Stadium complex. The defending World Series champions will be the home team on March 5.  After facing UM and FIU, the Marlins will return to Grapefruit League play with a game at the Mets in Port St. Lucie, Fla., on March 8. Joe Frisaro is a reporter for MLB.com. He writes a blog, called The Fish Pond. Follow him on Twitter @JoeFrisaro. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Joe Frisaro
